text: Congratulations to President Trump and VP-elect Vance. America is at its strongest when we use ingenuity and innovation to improve lives here in the U.S. and around the world. I hope we can work together now to build a brighter future for everyone.

Thank you @AbiyAhmedAli for your warm welcome during my visit to Ethiopia. I’m inspired by our insightful discussions on Ethiopia’s development progress, and I’m excited by the opportunity to continue supporting our partners to track and accelerate progress in health, agriculture and financial inclusion. @PMEthiopia

Aidan’s work to end polio saved countless lives and touched even more. His optimism and commitment to helping others made him a leader in the field—and a great friend to everyone who knew him. I'm sending my deepest condolences to his family and loved ones during this difficult time.

Thanks to incredible work by Indian experts, a study conducted on the Immediate Kangaroo Mother Care (IKMC) method in India, reveals some amazing findings about saving newborn lives. Such innovations have the potential to save countless lives globally. @narendramodi @JPNadda
With Khanmigo’s assistance, teachers at First Avenue Elementary are finding it easier to personalize learning for each individual student. https://gatesnot.es/3xFdsU5
I'm glad you could join us at the @Breakthrough Energy Summit! #BESummit24

At the first Breakthrough Energy Summit in 2022, I shared updates on the cutting-edge concepts and companies we’re supporting that address the five grand challenges of climate change. This year, in London, we have something else to share: a whole portfolio of clean technologies that aren’t just promising but proven and ready for the market—today. https://gatesnot.es/4cyZ3Yf #BESummit24

Welcome to #BESummit24! The need to decarbonize our world has never been more pressing, but with extraordinary advancements in climate innovation, we are on the cusp of transformative change.  Tomorrow’s opening plenary promises to be an inspiring start.
It was great to talk to @FaceTheNation about bipartisan support for nuclear energy and the incredible opportunity we have to meet America’s growing electrification needs.

I’ve been waiting for this day for nearly 20 years: Today, we broke ground on the first-ever Natrium plant in Kemmerer, Wyoming. This next-generation nuclear power plant is a big step towards safe, abundant, zero-carbon energy. https://gatesnot.es/4ekV2Zd

Congratulations to @narendramodi on winning a third term as Prime Minister. You have strengthened India's position as a source of innovation for global progress in sectors like health, agriculture, women-led development, and digital transformation. Look forward to a continued partnership to enhance the lives of people across India and the world. @PMOIndia
My upcoming memoir Source Code is all about the lessons and experiences that laid the foundation for everything in my life that followed. https://gatesnot.es/source-code-tw
Although I’ve read and watched a lot about the war in Vietnam, The Women by Kristin Hannah made me think about it in a new light. https://gatesnot.es/3WZ9qjv
These books and TV series make for the perfect summer “sides.” Eating BBQ before, during, or after you enjoy them is the sauce on top.

I didn’t intend to go deep on the topic of service with my summer list—but it’s certainly as relevant today as ever. I hope you’re inspired to read or watch one of these recommendations. https://gatesnot.es/3WPO6gc
From dairy cows to sanitation in schools, these partnerships prove that remarkable things happen when you get the right people together.
If you're passionate about education, you need to read this book. Sal offers a compelling vision for harnessing AI to expand opportunity for all.

I want to thank Melinda for her critical contributions to the Foundation from its very beginning. As a co-founder and co-chair Melinda has been instrumental in shaping our strategies and initiatives, significantly impacting global health and gender equality.  Looking ahead, I remain fully committed to the Foundation’s work across all our strategies, and to realizing the opportunities we have to continue improving the lives of millions around the world.  I am sorry to see Melinda leave, but I am sure she will have a huge impact in her future philanthropic work.  Our foundation team is incredibly strong and deeply passionate about our work, and under the leadership of Mark Suzman, and a committed board of trustees, I am confident we will keep making substantial progress on our mission to create a world where every person can live a healthy, productive life.
Around the world, unexpected partnerships are driving progress and helping the next generation—like nine-year-old Omphile—reach their fullest potential: https://gatesnot.es/3UP5f8u

"To thine own self be true:” I can never stop reading, even when I'm traveling for work. ​This picture is from Helsingør, Denmark. Helsingør, also known as Elsinore, is home to Kronborg Castle, the setting for Shakespeare’s Hamlet.
I’ve recently become fascinated by an ancient family of grains called millets. Here’s why: https://gatesnot.es/3W9XT06

From 1990 to 2019, child mortality worldwide was cut by more than half. It’s one of the most important things humanity has ever done—and now, we have the opportunity to do it again: https://gatesnot.es/3VTlZMF
During my visit to India, I saw how AI and DPI are improving access to education, healthcare, and lives of small farmers, and how these technologies can be transformative for the world.
The most unexpected connections can lead to incredible progress. https://b-gat.es/43GbTAG

Thank you, Prime Minister @NarendraModi, for taking the time to discuss India's tech-driven development. Breakthroughs in AI and digital public infrastructure—along with innovations in agriculture, education, and healthcare—are solving some of the country's most critical challenges and should be models for the world. @PMOIndia
I went to Texas to see the future. It did not disappoint. https://b-gat.es/49eAbmq
If you want to catch a glimpse of our country’s clean energy future, you should head on down to the Lone Star State. https://gatesnot.es/3VrMad8

Dax Shepard and Monica Padman joined me on a recent trip to India where we talked about remarkable global health progress, what makes the country so vibrant, and how AI can unlock potential in a number of different sectors—in India and around the world: https://spoti.fi/3ThCvmH
A few highlights from another incredible trip to India: https://gatesnot.es/3vbmkzd

Congratulations @pbasinga on becoming Director of @GatesAfrica. The Gates Foundation is committed to tackling Africa's most pressing development challenges, and I know Paulin has the skills and experience to take this work to the next level.

Thank you @lakshmiunwomen for your hospitality. Your commitment towards a gender-equal world is inspiring, and I thoroughly enjoyed our discussion on the positive impact of women-led development. Congratulations on your book #SwallowingTheSun.

Thank you @narendramodi for the invitation to visit the impressive Statue of Unity. It is an engineering marvel and a great tribute to Sardar Patel. Also great to see it is creating economic opportunity for local tribal communities, especially women.

I met with @AshwiniVaishnaw to talk about India’s AI ecosystem and how it can be used to improve health, agriculture, and education. India’s digital public infrastructure journey is a fantastic model for emerging economies. @BMGFIndia hopes to support the Indian government’s initiatives to build open, secure, and interoperable systems that are inclusive and create strong digital economies.

It was inspiring to learn about India's holistic approach to children's nutrition and wellbeing, @smritiirani. Initiatives like POSHAN 2.0 and Poshan Utsav Book are paving the way for informed decisions about nutrition.

Thank you for sharing your book about how India is contributing to the global good, @DrSJaishankar. I enjoyed our discussion about India’s G20 Presidency, DPI, health, education, and women’s economic empowerment. India plays a vital role in fostering cross-country collaboration through knowledge and technology transfer.

Thank you, @HardeepSPuri, for hosting us today and for hosting an insightful discussion with @Rajeev_GoI and some of India’s great minds. The country’s growth story exemplifies the power of collective effort in driving impactful change. Strengthening cross-sectoral collaborations can solve the toughest challenges around the world. @MoHUA_India

It was great to see digital health innovations like the Arogya Maitri Disaster Management Cube-BHISHM and discuss our shared commitment to leverage Indian research and technology to eliminate TB, sickle cell, and maternal anemia with @mansukhmandviya. Looking forward to continued partnership between @BMGFIndia and @MoHFW_INDIA.

It is always inspiring to meet with @narendramodi and there was a lot to discuss. We talked about AI for public good; DPI; women-led development; innovation in agriculture, health, and climate adaptation; and how we can take lessons from India to the world. @PMOIndia
Clean hydrogen is the Swiss Army Knife of decarbonization. @electric_H2 is doing incredible work to make it affordable and more widely available. https://b-gat.es/3rF1mai
It's great to see all the innovative climate solutions featured this week. https://b-gat.es/3PDRp4W

U.S. students flunk algebra more than any other course—but one middle school in Southern California is working to change that with a new approach to teaching math that involves McDonald’s and movie theater popcorn.
I made a playlist for all the other math nerds out there. https://spoti.fi/3ZI0qP2

If our goal is to end poverty, we must build stronger economies. And that begins with helping women transform from simply participating in the economy to achieving full economic power.  Read @MelindaGates's op-ed for @TheEconomist: https://tinyurl.com/b5mbwz82

In this fascinating @NYTimes article, @snolen shares how an international team of scientists, including @TargetMalaria, is using cutting-edge technology to fight an ancient disease. https://b-gat.es/46gPQ46

I joined a math class at Chula Vista Middle School, where real-world problems—like how to get the most bang for your buck when buying movie theater popcorn—are changing the way students learn America’s least favorite subject. https://gatesnot.es/3LICB3O
I profiled Dr. Karikó on my blog last year. You can read more about why I'm so impressed by her and Dr. Weissman's remarkable work here. https://gatesnot.es/3PDVCpe

.@kkariko and @WeissmanLab saw the potential of mRNA when few others did and fought tooth and nail to study it—resulting in revolutionary vaccines that have saved tens of millions of lives. Congratulations on your well-deserved Nobel Prize; your work has truly changed the world. https://b-gat.es/3RBXqSm
Happy Birthday President Carter. You are an inspiration and your lifesaving work has changed the world forever. https://gates.ly/48sJAaO @CarterCenter
It’s been a lot of fun making my podcast Unconfuse Me. Check out some of my favorite highlights so far: https://b-gat.es/4669v6C #InternationalPodcastDay

.@antoraenergy and @rondoenergy are making remarkable progress on thermal batteries. Their clean energy solutions are helping address industrial emissions by storing power and scaling up—without increasing costs. https://b-gat.es/3teVogZ
One thing the world could always use more of: hope. https://b-gat.es/3PTRQtg

Dr. M. S. Swaminathan's leadership improved India's food security and influenced global efforts to combat hunger. His passing is a profound loss that will be deeply felt around the world. @doctorsoumya @mssrf https://b-gat.es/48zOcMw
From software to climate action, my life passions have centered on transformation and learning. And I firmly believe that innovation can address the toughest challenges of climate change.

This journey led me to prioritize innovation as the key to addressing climate change because that's how you lower costs and make technologies accessible to everyone. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z4FtUdAtwm4

My journey into climate action started with a simple question, "Where are all the lights?" during my travels in sub-Saharan Africa. I realized the importance of affordable and reliable energy for people's lives and economic development.
As I think about the next big meeting on climate that I’ll be attending–#COP28–I want to share my own journey on climate change, and why I founded @Breakthrough. https://b-gat.es/3PS4qJk
Linguist @JohnHMcWhorter dives into the "it is what it is" debate in @nytopinion. It’s a fascinating, in-depth exploration of language evolution and multiple meanings. https://b-gat.es/3EQ52cd
A fantastic talk about how improving human wellbeing and sustainability can—and must—be achieved simultaneously.
The challenge of climate change can seem daunting, but there are reasons to be optimistic. Thank you for having me, @dgelles @NYTimes.
I had a great conversation with @SethRogen and @IamLaurenMiller about using comedy to support Alzheimer’s caregivers through @WeAreHFC: https://spoti.fi/3EMtGKL

When my dad was living with Alzheimer's, I became very close with his caregivers. They experienced the good and bad days with us—and humor was a necessary coping mechanism for us all. It helped us find moments of joy and connection during the worst of times. #WorldAlzheimersDay

I’m proud to honor my dad’s legacy on #WorldAlzheimersDay with our inaugural cohort of the William H. Gates Sr. Fellowship. Congratulations to this year’s fellows—I admire your passion and look forward to seeing the progress in ADRD research.

Thank you to all the remarkable individuals and global leaders who joined us at the @GatesFoundation #Goalkeepers2030 event today. Urgent action is needed to achieve a more equitable and safe future for all by 2030—but today left me more inspired than ever that it can be done.

Stopping children from dying: one of humanity's greatest achievements.  Dramatic progress has been made across the world.  One example: In 1970, 1-in-3 newborns in Malawi died before the age of five.  In 1990, this was 1-in-4.  Today it's 1-in-24.

I’m looking forward to the week ahead. I’m in NYC for UNGA, New York Climate Week, and the @gatesfoundation #Goalkeepers2030 event. This year marks the halfway point for the global Sustainable Development Goals—and a critical time to assess our progress and the work we still need to do. Read our report: https://gates.ly/3rgClSz

Over the past decade, the field of child health has advanced beyond my expectations. If our delivery of care can keep pace with our learning—and reach every family in every community—we’ll get closer and closer to a world where every newborn survives and all preventable child deaths are actually prevented. #Goalkeepers2030 https://b-gat.es/3sT424v

I'm grateful to President Bush for his leadership on @PEPFAR—and for reminding us of Michael Gerson’s inspiring words about the vital importance of protecting and extending PEPFAR's life-saving legacy. https://b-gat.es/45YZxUz
A mother dies in childbirth every two minutes. By making innovations accessible to those who need them most, the lives of two million additional mothers and babies could be saved by 2030.

Thank you @SenSchumer, @SenatorHeinrich, @SenatorRounds, and @SenToddYoung for your leadership in organizing the AI Insight Forums, and for Congress’ commitment to building its AI expertise. I look forward to continuing the conversation.

The potential of AI is limitless—but we will only realize that potential if government, the private sector, and civil society work together to maximize the technology’s benefits and minimize its risks.

Thanks to initiatives like CHAMPS, doctors are better understanding why some babies die—which allows them to adapt their treatment protocols to save millions more: https://b-gat.es/3sT424v #Goalkeepers2030

“The biggest failure we have in providing health care to mothers and children is a failure of imagination... If we can send a rover to Mars, we can imagine a world where mothers and babies can live long and healthy lives.” –Dr. Paul Farmer of @PIH #Goalkeepers2030 https://b-gat.es/3sT424v

The #G20 reached a groundbreaking consensus on the role of digital public infrastructure as a critical accelerator of the Sustainable Development Goals. I'm optimistic about the potential of DPI to support a safer, healthier, and more just world. Kudos to PM @narendramodi. https://www.deccanherald.com/world/g20-leaders-call-for-global-governance-for-ai-inclusive-digital-public-infra-for-service-delivery-2679798
I’ve met some remarkable individuals who’ve dedicated their lives to one of the most important challenges of our time: Improving maternal and newborn health outcomes. https://b-gat.es/3EFOzqR

The brain can tolerate an incredible degree of needless complexity, which comes in handy when you're learning a new language. Right now, I’m learning French, and John McWhorter helped me get unconfused about its complicated sophistication: https://spoti.fi/44M1NwY
There are over seven thousand, but many of us grow up learning only one. I asked linguist @JohnHMcWhorter to unconfuse me about the complexities of language: https://spoti.fi/3ZdPbNS

To meet the overlapping crises of our time, the global North and global South need to work together—but that can only happen once trust that was lost is rebuilt. @MSuzman captures this well. https://b-gat.es/45LIcOQ
Hint: I talk about this with @JohnHMcWhorter on the latest episode of Unconfuse Me, available on your favorite podcast platform. https://spoti.fi/3EwGNQ4
Approximately how many languages exist in the world?

As my colleague @EnockChikava writes, it’s critical to invest in research and innovations that will help African farmers adapt to climate change. By partnering with organizations like @CGIAR, we can create long-term solutions. #ACS23 https://b-gat.es/3PaOD6O
I really enjoy talking to @mustafasuleyman about how to use AI to solve some of the world's greatest challenges. He's an remarkable thinker, and I aways learn a lot from him. https://b-gat.es/3Z8eZLF
It’s interesting to see approaches teachers are implementing to engage students about complex subjects. https://theconversation.com/3-reasons-we-use-graphic-novels-to-teach-math-and-physics-211171

I loved hearing about @questlove’s amazing life story. As a 10-year-old, he was operating the smoke machine and spotlight at nightclubs where his parents worked and getting his start in music: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rmpDvbryaxY
Congratulations on a terrific career! I'll miss watching you play. It was so much fun to share a court with you and support the @rogerfedererfdn together at the Match for Africa in 2018.
As a pickler, it’s fun to see the sport grow. https://b-gat.es/3qKOajW

Ahmir ‘@Questlove’ Thompson is a living encyclopedia of music history. I was lucky enough to sit down with him for my podcast, Unconfuse Me, and he gave me some great recommendations. So I created a playlist of all the artists he referenced in our conversation. https://spoti.fi/44yvFwS
I love looking back at some of the good times we’ve had together over the years. https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLxf-CDjxvNVpSKFnxtWepiz5nGO4cluCM
Happy 93rd birthday to my friend Warren!
I’m a fan of @Questlove’s mission to make plant-based foods more accessible to everyone—including Phillies fans and President Obama, who love his meatless cheesesteaks. https://gatesnot.es/3PeZcXL
I’m trying to fit a few more books and shows in before the summer ends. If you’re like me and looking for some recommendations, here’s what I suggest. https://gatesnot.es/3P9slUl
